availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington King (Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Tabitha Burchet King. Father of John King, Daniel King, Joel King, James King, Woodson King, Alsa King, Andrew King, Angeline King, Elizabeth King, George King, Jonah King, and Jason King. Farmer in Hancock County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Jackson County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Hancock County, District 33, p. 42A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson County, McKee, p. 859.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson County, Pond Creek, p. 224B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994039, Jackson County Births, p. 529.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 8778.
"George Washington King (1816-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial 5205491, accessed January 15, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5205491.
